Europa League
ASSE: the weekend of European opponents!
AS Monaco's torer this weekend, the Greens must now confirm in the Europa League. Discover the result of the European opponents of ASSE with various fortunes.
04 Nov 2019, 13:00 by Antoine Chirat



Harold MoukoudiClub previous: Le HavreTransfer fee: noneIcon Sport



Jean-Eudes Aholou Previous club: AS MonacoTransfer fee: none (ready) Icon Sport



Alpha SissokoClub previous: ClermontTransfer allowance: noneIcon Sport



Yohan CabayeClub previous: without clubTransfer fee: noneIcon Sport



Sergi PalenciaClub previous: FC BarcelonaTransfer allowance: 2 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Miguel TraucoClub previous: FlamengoTransfer allowance: 1 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Denis BouangaClub previous: N√Æmes OlympiqueTransfer fee: ‚Ç¨ 4.5 M Icon Sport



Ryad BoudebouzClub previous: Betis SevillaTransfer allowance: 3.5 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Zaydou Youssouf Previous club: Girondins de BordeauxTransfer allowance: 2 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport

ASSE: all the recruits of the transfer window 2019




The Greens are back in the forefront in Ligue 1 since the arrival of Claude Puel. 20th at the time of his signing, the St Etienne have not lost since and point to 8th place, only two points from the 2nd of the championship. The last of his group in the Europa League, the For√©ziens must absolutely win on the lawn of Oleksandria to revive and believe in a qualification. Discover without further delay the results of the three teams of the group of Greens.




Wolfsburg falls heavily




Wolfsburg loses foot in Dortmund + 9 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

In Germany, it was a day of shock for Joshua Guilavogui's teammates who were on the pitch at Borussia Dortmund. Solid in the first half, the Loupes lost their footing in the second to lose 3-0 heavily on achievements of Hazard, Guerreiro and Gotze. They now point to 8th place with 17 units, but only two points from Dortmund 2nd.



Ghent goes on




The Giant confirms + 9 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

A little further east, the Ukrainians from Oleksandria, who will receive the Greens on Thursday in the Europa League, made a good performance in their stadium by winning 3-1 against FC Mariupol. With this success, they glue back to the leading car of the championship and are now 5th with 23 points. Finally, the Belgians of La Gantoise continue their good race by taking all three at home against Standard 3-1 Li√®ge. With this new performance, Jonathan David's team-mates are now just two points behind their opponents this weekend and remain in 3rd place.
